alert.note: Alert for McCreary; Pulaski; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 6:10PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Wayne, south central Pulaski and southwestern McCreary Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 610 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hidalgo, or 10 miles southwest of Monticello, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Slickford around 615 PM EDT. Cooper around 620 PM EDT. Oil Valley and Burfield around 625 PM EDT. Monticello, Barrier, Coopersville, Rockeybranch, Griffin, Steubenville and Parmleysville around 630 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Gregory, Kidds Crossing, Betsey, Denney, Ritner, Delta, Slavens and Kidder. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for south central Kentucky.
